bill.title: An Act Relating To Near-term And Long-term Economic Development
bill.description: An Act Relating To Near-term And Long-term Economic Development

referrals.name: Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs

history.action: Committee Bill read first time
Rules Suspended and Taken up for Immediate Consideration as moved by Rep. Kitzmiller of Montpelier
Committed to Committee on Commerce and Economic Development by motion of Rep. Kitzmiller of Montpelier
Referred to Committee on Ways and Means per Rule 35(a)
Referred to Committee on Appropriations per Rule 35(a)
Rep. Kitzmiller of Montpelier reported for the committee on Commerce and Economic Development
Rep. Clarkson of Woodstock, recommended for the committee on Ways and Means
Amendment as offered by Rep. Shand of Weathersfield agreed to
Rep. Manwaring of Wilmington, recommended for the committee on Appropriations
Amendment of Committee on Commerce and Economic Development agreed to
Report of Committee on Ways and Means agreed to.
Report of Committee on Appropriations agreed to.
Rep. Shand of Weathersfield moved to amend the bill
Third Reading Ordered

Amendment as offered by Rep. Donovan of Burlington, Wizowaty of Burlington, Haas of Rochester, Myers of Essex, Pellett of Chester, Lorber of Burlington, Ancel of Calais, Branagan of Georgia, Burke of Brattleboro, Cheney of Norwich, Clarkson of Woodstock, Copeland-Hanzas of Bradford, Courcelle of Rutland City, Davis of Washington, Donahue of Northfield, Edwards of Brattleboro, Emmons of Springfield, Evans of Essex, French of Randolph, Grad of Moretown, Head of South Burlington, Heath of Westford, Hooper of Montpelier, Johnson of South Hero, Keenan of St. Albans City, Lanpher of Vergennes, Lenes of Shelburne, Leriche of Hardwick, Manwaring of Wilmington, Martin of Springfield, Martin of Wolcott, Milkey of Brattleboro, Miller of Shaftsbury, Minter of Waterbury, Mook of Bennington, Nuovo of Middlebury, O'Brien of Richmond, Partridge of Windham, Pugh of South Burlington, Ram of Burlington, Smith of Mendon, Spengler of Colchester, Sweaney of Windsor, Taylor of Barre City, Toll of Danville, Waite-Simpson of Essex,
Rep. Donovan of Burlington demanded yeas and nays
Roll Call Results Passed -- Needed 71 of 140 to Pass -- Yeas = 128, Nays = 12
Amendment as offered by Rep. Ram of Burlington agreed to
Amendment as offered by Rep. Komline of Dorset disagreed to
Rep. Komline of Dorset demanded yeas and nays
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 69 of 136 to Pass -- Yeas = 36, Nays = 100
Read Third time and Passed
Read 1st time & referred to Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs
Rules suspended & taken up for immediate consideration, on motion of Senator Mazza
Read 2nd time
Reported without recommendation by Senator Illuzzi for Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs
Proposal of amendment by Senator(s) Mazza; text
Proposal of amendment agreed to on roll call, requested by Senator Snelling, Passed -- Needed 13 of 24 to Pass -- Yeas = 23, Nays = 1
Proposal of amendment by Senator Racine; text
Proposal of amendment agreed to on roll call, requested by Senator Racine, Passed -- Needed 13 of 25 to Pass -- Yeas = 13, Nays = 12
3rd reading ordered
Rules suspended & bill placed on all remaining stages of passage, on motion of Senator Mazza
Read 3rd time & adopted in concurrence with proposal of amendment on roll call, requested by Senator Snelling, Passed -- Needed 13 of 25 to Pass -- Yeas = 23, Nays = 2
Rules suspended & messaged to House forthwith, on motion of Senator Mazza
Rules Suspended and Taken up for Immediate Consideration as moved by Rep. Komline of Dorset
Senate Proposal of Amendment not concurred in and Committee of Conference requested upon motion of Rep. Kitzmiller of Montpelier
Speaker appointed Kitzmiller of Montpelier, Deen of Westminster and Obuchowski of Rockingham as members of the Committee of Conference on the part of the House
Rules suspended and bill messaged forthwith to the Senate as moved by Rep. Komline of Dorset
Committee of Conference appointed: Senators Illuzzi, Miller, and Hartwell
Rules suspended & taken up for immediate consideration, on motion of Senator Shumlin
Committee of Conference report submitted by Senator Illuzzi for Committee, text
Committee of Conference report adopted
Rules suspended & messaged to House forthwith, on motion of Senator Shumlin
Rules Suspended and Taken up for Immediate Consideration as moved by Rep. Nease of Johnson
Committee of Conference report agreed to (House bill)
Rules Suspended and Action on the bill messaged to the Senate forthwith and the bill delivered to the Governor forthwith as moved by Rep. Nease of Johnson.
Delivered to the Governor on 5/26/2009
Signed by Governor on 6/1/2009
